intro: Camissonia boothii subsp. rutila, commonly known as the golden camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its leaves are often linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
